image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: After Sweden, more cases of mpox to come in Europe: WHO
item.description: The WHO on Thursday warned further imported cases of the new, more dangerous mpox strain in Europe were likely, after Sweden announced the first such infection outside Africa in an outbreak that has killed hundreds in the DR Congo. The case recorded in a traveller in Sweden was announced the day after the World Health Organization declared the mpox surge in Africa a public health emergency of international concern -- the highest alarm it can sound.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5, including assistant and doctors, charged in Matthew Perry’s fatal ketamine overdose case
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Day two of Gaza ceasefire talks under way in Doha; Hamas skips meet
item.description: Negotiations aimed at fostering peace between Israel and Hamas through a Gaza ceasefire agreement were set to resume today. US officials termed Thursday's discussions in Doha as constructive. Talks involving CIA Director William Burns aim to end the ongoing conflict, which has resulted in a humanitarian crisis and a high death toll in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Joe Biden and Kamal Harris heckled by Anti-Israel protestors
item.description: During President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris's first joint address since Biden announced his 2024 candidacy, anti-Israel protesters disrupted the event in Prince George’s County, Maryland. Despite the commotion, Biden continued his speech, humorously acknowledging his age and referring to former President Trump as “Donald Dump.” Harris praised Biden, expressing strong support for his presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden and Kamala make joint appearance, first since Biden dropped out of presidential race
item.description: US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris made their first joint public appearance in Maryland, marking a significant Democratic transition. Biden highlighted his achievements in reducing prescription drug prices, while Harris energized the crowd, emphasizing the impact of these policies. Harris secured the Democratic nomination for president with Tim Walz as her running mate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Ernesto: Bermuda on alert as storm grows stronger, power outages and flooding continue in Puerto Rico
item.description: Hurricane Ernesto, a Category 1 storm, is intensifying towards Bermuda. It caused heavy damage in Puerto Rico, leaving many without power. The National Hurricane Center anticipated Ernesto could become a major hurricane by Friday. Residents in Bermuda were advised to prepare for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake shakes Taiwan: USGS
item.description: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck off Taiwan’s east coast near Hualien early Friday morning. Initially reported as magnitude 6.3, the tremor occurred at a depth of 15 kilometers. Mobile alerts advised people to stay calm and seek cover. Authorities confirmed no immediate damage. Taiwan frequently experiences earthquakes due to its tectonic location.

item.title: Netanyahu rejects claims of discussing Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal with Trump
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US arrests reputed Peruvian gang leader wanted for 23 killings in his home country
item.description: Gianfranco Torres-Navarro, the leader of the Peruvian gang 'Los Killers' and wanted for 23 killings, was arrested by US immigration authorities in New York. Torres-Navarro entered the US illegally and was detained at a facility in Buffalo. His girlfriend, Michelle Sol Ivanna Ortiz Ubillus, was also arrested and is being held in Pennsylvania.

item.title: US and allies push for ceasefire as talks resume
item.description: The United States announced a promising start to ceasefire talks in Gaza, led by CIA Director William Burns in Doha, Qatar. The discussions aim to end the conflict that has claimed over 40,000 lives and caused severe humanitarian issues. Hamas did not participate initially but is ready if new commitments are achieved from Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

Perry's assistant, 2 doctors & a drug dealer indicted for ketamine death
item.description: Matthew Perry's assistant and others were charged for providing the ketamine that led to his death. Perry was found face down in his hot tub on October 28. Two doctors and a drug dealer were involved in delivering the drugs, despite Perry's drug abuse history. Two have pleaded guilty, and another agreed to plead guilty.

item.title: New mpox strain outside Africa: 1st case in Sweden
item.description: Sweden reported its first case of the Clade 1b subclade of mpox outside Africa, as the nation's public health agency announced. The patient was infected during a visit to a heavily impacted area in Africa. The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control maintains the risk to the general population in Europe is very low.
